definition: lacking effort; without care
sentence: Only a cursory inspection of the building's electrical wiring was done.

definition: scary or frightening; seeming impossible
sentence: The daunting task of reorganizing the entire library took several months to complete.

definition: look up to someone or something as a god
sentence: Ancient civilizations would often deify their rulers, worshipping them as gods.

definition: boring; unlikely to excite
sentence: She liked the movie, but I thought it was humdrum.

definition: having a distaste for humans and society
sentence: The misanthropic writer avoided all social gatherings.

definition: a misleading or inaccurate name
sentence: {ldquo}International Airport{rdquo} is something of a misnomer, since almost all the arriving and departing flights are local.

definition: someone who spends money recklessly
sentence: The spendthrift heir squandered his entire inheritance within a year.

definition: shameless and excessively forward
sentence: He exhibited a brazen disregard for other people's feelings.

definition: understand something subjectively
sentence: The way the court construes various words has changed over time.

definition: strongly desire; yearn for
sentence: She did not covet her neighbor's possessions, being content with what she had.

definition: highly proficient; skilled
sentence: The surgeon's deft hands moved with precision during the delicate operation.

definition: decrease in intensity; lessen
sentence: We waited for the wind/storm to abate.

definition: differing from what is normal; atypical
sentence: Researchers could not explain the anomalous test results.

definition: naive; inexperienced; plain and simple
sentence: Her artless charm made everyone feel comfortable in her presence.

definition: extremely noisy; grating
sentence: The cacophonous noise from the construction site made it impossible to concentrate.

definition: treat like a god; deeply venerate
sentence: She died 100 years ago and was canonized in Rome last year.

definition: provocative; causing conflict
sentence: The fire was started by an incendiary bomb/device.

definition: provide energy or vitality to
sentence: A brisk walk in the cool morning air always invigorates me.

definition: representing the standard example
sentence: Einstein's theory of relativity is paradigmatic of revolutionary scientific thinking.

definition: great wisdom or intelligence
sentence: The profundity of the philosopher's writings continues to influence modern thought.

definition: not warm or friendly; impersonal
sentence: He remained aloof from office politics, preferring to focus on his work.

definition: a disturbingly loud noise
sentence: The clangor of the factory machinery made conversation impossible.

definition: prove a belief or idea false
sentence: The article debunks the notion that life exists on Mars.

definition: exceptionally small in size or stature
sentence: The diminutive cottage looked like something from a fairy tale.

definition: able to be recognized or understood
sentence: There was no discernible difference between the two paintings.

definition: emotionally distanced from someone
sentence: He became estranged from his family after the bitter dispute over the will.

definition: excessive, especially in terms of cost
sentence: The wedding was an extravagant affair with hundreds of guests and elaborate decorations.

definition: highly imaginative; unrealistic
sentence: The artist was known for her fanciful illustrations of imaginary creatures.

definition: infringing on others privacy; spreading rapidly
sentence: Invasive species can devastate native ecosystems.

definition: not diligent or careful; casual
sentence: The company's lax security policies led to a major data breach.

definition: treat someone or something as insignificant
sentence: The new policies threatened to marginalize small business owners.

definition: a stylish and confident manner
sentence: She played the role of hostess with great panache.

definition: moving slowly or laboriously
sentence: The plodding pace of the bureaucracy frustrated everyone involved.

definition: label or mark as disgraceful
sentence: Society stigmatizes welfare recipients.

definition: intensely passionate
sentence: The zealous advocate fought tirelessly for environmental protection.

definition: excessively patriotic or biased in favor of a group
sentence: His chauvinistic attitudes made him unpopular among his colleagues.

definition: demonstrating tenacity and unwillingness to give up
sentence: Her dogged efforts eventually paid off.

definition: trick or fool someone
sentence: The con artist tried to dupe unsuspecting tourists with fake tickets.

definition: overstepping boundaries, often in an overconfident way
sentence: It would be presumptuous (of me) to tell the manager how to do things.

definition: undermine or weaken, typically an authority
sentence: They conspired to subvert the government.

definition: characterized by extremely loud noise
sentence: The clamorous crowd demanded answers from the officials.

definition: able to be explained or understood
sentence: The strange phenomenon was perfectly explicable once the scientists examined the data.

definition: limited in outlook or experience; narrow
sentence: The insular community had little contact with the outside world.

definition: lacking proper respect or seriousness
sentence: He has a delightfully irreverent sense of humor.

definition: dislike greatly, often with disgust
sentence: I loathe having to wake up early on weekends.

definition: evil and harmful; speak about someone in a bitter manner
sentence: Her supporters say she is being unfairly maligned in the press.

definition: hard, harsh, or severe in manner
sentence: The stern professor rarely smiled during lectures.

definition: pertaining to a guess or inference made with limited data
sentence: The theory remains conjectural until more evidence is gathered.

definition: characterized by a showy, confident, or audacious display
sentence: The flamboyant entertainer captivated audiences with his colorful costumes.

definition: inspire or stir up to action or heightened activity
sentence: The tragic event helped galvanize the community into action.

definition: lacking selectivity or judgment
sentence: They participated in the indiscriminate slaughter of countless innocent victims.

definition: causing irritation or annoyance
sentence: The nettlesome regulations created headaches for small business owners.

definition: render ineffective, cancel out or invalidate
sentence: The court's decision could nullify the entire agreement.

definition: existing or seeming to exist everywhere at once
sentence: The problem is omnipresent and unavoidable.

definition: displace or eject from a position or place
sentence: The rebels ousted the dictator from power.

definition: able to be touched or felt; obvious
sentence: I felt a palpable sense of relief.

definition: hardly sufficient, meager, or minimal
sentence: There was scant evidence to support the prosecutor's claims.

definition: sneaky or dishonest actions
sentence: The investigation uncovered widespread skullduggery in the organization.

definition: a courteous harmony or mutual respect toward others
sentence: The two nations maintained comity despite their historical differences.

definition: characterized by warmth and sincerity
sentence: We received a cordial greeting from our hostess at the party.

definition: refrain or abstain from doing something
sentence: She had to forbear from commenting on his ridiculous outfit.

definition: lacking clear planning, order, or direction
sentence: We were given a haphazard tour of the city.

definition: a mixture or assortment of different things
sentence: The museum's collection was a hodgepodge of artifacts from different eras.

definition: obstruct or hinder progress
sentence: He claims that economic growth is being impeded by government regulations.

definition: motivated primarily by desire for monetary gain
sentence: Critics accused the company of having mercenary motives for its charity work.

definition: surpass or do better than
sentence: Demand for the product began to outstrip supply within weeks.

definition: skill in handling difficult situations without offense
sentence: The peace talks required great tact on the part of both leaders.

definition: lacking significance or importance
sentence: The trifling amount of money was hardly worth arguing about.

definition: quickness and keenness in understanding and judgment
sentence: Her political acumen won her the election.

definition: attribute or credit something to a particular cause
sentence: Historians ascribe the fall of the empire to a combination of internal corruption and external pressures.

definition: confused, bewildered, or perplexed
sentence: Many people are totally befuddled by the tax code.

definition: indirect or not straightforward; avoiding confrontation
sentence: The politician gave evasive answers to the journalist's questions.

definition: short-sighted; lacking creativity
sentence: The company's myopic focus on short-term profits hurt its long-term growth.

definition: appearing casually calm or indifferent
sentence: He was surprisingly nonchalant about winning the award.

definition: deep in thought
sentence: The child sat by himself, looking pensive.

definition: indicate or warn that something unpleasant is going to happen
sentence: The distant thunder portended a storm.

definition: cut off or put an end to
sentence: He severed the lowest tree limbs.

definition: replace or take the place of
sentence: This edition supersedes the previous one.

definition: promote or praise energetically
sentence: The company is running advertisements touting the drug's effectiveness.

definition: decrease in power, size, or intensity
sentence: The moon waxes and then wanes.

definition: energetic, noisy, and lively
sentence: A large and boisterous crowd attended the concert.

definition: honorable and polite
sentence: The chivalrous gentleman held the door open for everyone entering the building.

definition: weakening or impairing strength
sentence: The debilitating illness confined her to bed for several weeks.

definition: amusing in a quirky or unusual way
sentence: His droll sense of humor kept everyone entertained.

definition: overly sentimental in an exaggerated or insincere way
sentence: The film's mawkish sentimentality failed to move critics.

definition: reverence for an individual
sentence: The courtiers made their obeisance before the king.

definition: risky and hazardous
sentence: The perilous journey across the mountains took several days.

definition: using humor or irony to criticize or mock
sentence: The satirical cartoon mocked political leaders.

definition: fake; not genuine
sentence: He claims that the trial was a sham.

definition: lacking energy; slow and listless
sentence: The sluggish economy showed few signs of recovery.

definition: marked by simplicity, frugality, and avoidance of luxury
sentence: They lived in spartan conditions.

definition: kind and charitable, producing good results
sentence: The beneficent donor funded numerous scholarships.

definition: shrewd and cautious
sentence: The canny investor anticipated the market downturn.

definition: experiencing nervousness, irritation, or sadness
sentence: The distressed homeowner faced foreclosure.

definition: decreasing steadily in size or quantity
sentence: The dwindling resources forced the company to cut costs.

definition: thorough; comprehensive in scope
sentence: She published an encyclopedic study of ancient Egypt.

definition: severely irritated or angry
sentence: The exasperated teacher repeated the instructions for the fifth time.

definition: interchangeable for another item of a similar type
sentence: Money is fungible, but sentimental items are not.

definition: capable of being used in place of each other
sentence: These words have similar meanings but they're not (freely) interchangeable (with each other).

definition: unrestrained and turbulent; extremely stormy
sentence: Their tempestuous relationship was marked by frequent arguments.

definition: a violation of a law, rule, or social norm
sentence: Minor transgressions were overlooked, but serious ones were punished.

definition: a natural liking or connection to a person, thing, or idea
sentence: They had much in common and felt a close affinity (for/to/with each other).

definition: showing generosity and concern for welfare of others
sentence: Her altruistic efforts to help the homeless inspired the community.

definition: overly detailed or ornamental
sentence: The baroque architecture featured elaborate ornamentation.

definition: hidden or concealed; not openly practiced
sentence: The agency conducted covert operations in foreign countries.

definition: intensely exciting
sentence: The roller coaster ride was exhilarating, leaving everyone breathless and laughing.

definition: intense enthusiasm toward something
sentence: The fervor surrounding her campaign continued right through election day.

definition: unreal or based on illusion
sentence: The apparent savings turned out to be illusory.

definition: symbolic rather than literal
sentence: The author used metaphorical language to describe emotions.

definition: harshly or bitterly critical; vitriolic
sentence: The critic wrote a scathing review of the performance.

definition: strong dislike or enmity; hostile attitude
sentence: There was clear animus between the two rival factions.

definition: a person who defends something being criticized
sentence: Critics dismissed him as an apologist for the regime.

definition: sharp or harsh in demeanor or style
sentence: Her astringent criticism left no room for excuses.

definition: show a mutual relationship or connection
sentence: Researchers tried to correlate diet with health outcomes.

definition: separate from something previously connected
sentence: His academic theories seemed divorced from practical reality.

definition: believing oneself or a group to be superior to others
sentence: Some accused the club of being elitist in its membership policies.

definition: requiring a lot of care, effort, or attention
sentence: The exacting standards of the competition eliminated most applicants.

definition: completely unable to understand; bewildered
sentence: The complex puzzle completely flummoxed even the most experienced solvers.

definition: producing good or abundant results
sentence: We had a fruitful discussion about the problems with the schedule.

definition: present from birth; innate
sentence: She seemed to have an inborn talent for music.

definition: a person with broad and comprehensive knowledge
sentence: Leonardo da Vinci was perhaps the greatest polymath in history.

definition: obedient to an authority or other people
sentence: He refused to be subservient to anyone.

definition: arousing desire or interest without fulfillment
sentence: The tantalizing aroma of freshly baked bread filled the kitchen.

definition: a state of apathy or lethargy
sentence: The news aroused him from his torpor.

definition: obstinate, contrary and unpredictable
sentence: The wayward teenager eventually found his path in life.

definition: appropriate or relevant to the situation
sentence: The ceremony concluded with the reading of an apropos poem.

definition: conceal or disguise
sentence: The soldiers began their attack under (the) cloak of darkness.

definition: very happy or proud
sentence: She was elated at/about/over the news.

definition: capture the attention or to charm
sentence: The book has enchanted children for almost a century.

definition: firmly ingrained and unlikely to change
sentence: Entrenched interests blocked attempts at reform.

definition: taking unfair advantage of a person or situation
sentence: Labor activists condemned the exploitative working conditions.

definition: able to be predicted or expected
sentence: No changes are expected in the foreseeable future.

definition: please or satisfy; make content
sentence: A guilty verdict would gratify the victim's relatives.

definition: mind or regard with care; pay attention
sentence: She failed to heed the warnings.

definition: exaggerated for effect, often sacrificing accuracy
sentence: The sensational headlines exaggerated the actual events.

definition: conflict or struggle
sentence: Years of civil strife had devastated the country.

definition: expressed in a subtle, restrained, or low-key manner
sentence: The understated elegance of her outfit impressed everyone.

definition: occur before something in time
sentence: These cave paintings antedate the pyramids by thousands of years.

definition: expel from a place, especially as punishment
sentence: The king decided to banish the traitor from the kingdom.

definition: control or restrain
sentence: She had to bridle her anger during the frustrating meeting.

definition: disappointed, dispirited, or depressed
sentence: The crestfallen team trudged off the field after their defeat.

definition: avoid or escape from, typically in a cunning way
sentence: The criminals have so far managed to evade the police.

definition: worsen, especially due to lack of attention
sentence: His wounds festered for days before he got medical attention.

definition: challenging or overthrowing tradition or beliefs
sentence: Her iconoclastic views challenged traditional assumptions.

definition: imprison or isolate
sentence: The dictator immured his political opponents in remote prisons.

definition: create something spontaneously without preparation
sentence: If you forget any of your lines, try to improvise.

definition: treat someone as a celebrity or hero
sentence: She was lionized everywhere after her novel won the Pulitzer Prize.

definition: consider or plan beforehand
sentence: The prosecution argued that the defendant had time to premeditate the crime.

definition: easily scared or startled; timid
sentence: The skittish horse spooked at every sudden noise.

definition: providing a general overview or summary
sentence: The report provided a synoptic overview of the industry.

definition: showing foresight or imagination
sentence: She is known as a visionary leader.

definition: confident and direct in claiming one's rights
sentence: She became more assertive after taking the leadership course.

definition: fake or fraudulent
sentence: The police discovered that the documents were bogus.

definition: causing great disruption or upheaval
sentence: The asteroid impact had cataclysmic consequences for life on Earth.

definition: enhancing or perfecting when combined with something else
sentence: She wore a new outfit with a complementary scarf.

definition: disclose or reveal information
sentence: The spy refused to divulge any classified information.

definition: recklessly daring; careless
sentence: Climbing without proper equipment was foolhardy.

definition: obstruct or delay progress
sentence: Lack of funding could hinder progress on the project.

definition: weaken or affect negatively
sentence: Smoking can impair your health.

definition: constant or unending, of something bad
sentence: The incessant noise from the construction site drove neighbors to complain.

definition: reluctant to spend or share; greedy
sentence: The miserly landlord refused to fix the broken heater.

definition: flexible or easily influenced
sentence: The pliant material could be molded into any shape.

definition: giving the impression that one is morally superior
sentence: His sanctimonious lectures about morality annoyed everyone.

definition: compromise, damage, or sully
sentence: The scandal threatened to tarnish her reputation.

definition: exhibiting little passion or eagerness; lukewarm
sentence: The proposal received only tepid support from committee members.

definition: criticize or scold severely
sentence: The coach began to upbraid the players for their poor performance.

definition: the state of being irritated or incensed
sentence: She expressed her vexation at the constant delays.

definition: assist or encourage, usually in wrongdoing
sentence: She abetted the thief in his getaway.

definition: eager to acquire and possess things
sentence: The acquisitive collector sought rare artifacts worldwide.

definition: showing indifference
sentence: He showed blithe disregard for the rights of others.

definition: move slowly and without purpose
sentence: Hurry up! There's no time to dawdle.

definition: change the direction or course of something
sentence: He tried to deflect attention from his own mistakes.

definition: one who disagrees or opposes authority
sentence: Many political dissidents were arrested.

definition: unpredictable and inconsistent
sentence: The erratic behavior of the stock market worried investors.

definition: causing annoyance or irritation
sentence: The irksome regulations created headaches for everyone.

definition: restrain, limit, or secure something
sentence: Debt can manacle a person's financial freedom for decades.

definition: using an excessive amount of words; long-winded
sentence: The speech was unnecessarily prolix.

definition: not proper or in good taste
sentence: Such unseemly behavior has no place in professional settings.

definition: true; genuine
sentence: The old attic was a veritable treasure trove of family heirlooms.

definition: a person who assists or follows another person or cause
sentence: The young acolyte assisted the priest during the ceremony.

definition: appoint or designate for a particular role or purpose
sentence: The priest anointed them (with oil).

definition: extract the most important information from something
sentence: The report aimed to distill complex information into simple terms.

definition: capable of making an error
sentence: Even experts are fallible and can make mistakes.

definition: awkward or clumsy
sentence: The gawky teenager eventually grew into a graceful adult.

definition: abandon or discard something that is no longer needed
sentence: The captain gave orders to jettison the cargo.

definition: breaking out again; reviving
sentence: Recrudescent nationalism threatened regional stability.

definition: not permanent; temporary
sentence: Fame can be transitory in the entertainment industry.

definition: informed or familiar about a particular topic
sentence: She kept abreast of developments in her field.

definition: deceptive in speech or action
sentence: The duplicitous advisor was secretly working for the competition.

definition: appearing or feeling sad or despondent
sentence: There's no need to look so glum—things will get better soon.

definition: lasting or remaining active throughout the year
sentence: Water shortage remains a perennial problem in the region.

definition: happening at a fortunate or opportune time
sentence: We had made a providential escape.

definition: baselessly speak ill of someone or something
sentence: She is being sued for slander.

definition: determined; staunch
sentence: The stalwart defender of human rights never wavered.

definition: defeat completely
sentence: They were vanquished in battle.

definition: very sad; very bad; awful
sentence: The team's woeful performance disappointed their fans.

definition: assert with confidence
sentence: He averred that he was innocent.

definition: an overwhelming concentration of something hostile
sentence: The enemy laid down a barrage of machine-gun fire as our platoon approached the bridge.

definition: that which releases emotional tension
sentence: Writing in her journal proved cathartic after the difficult experience.

definition: decode or determine the meaning of something difficult
sentence: Experts worked to decipher the ancient inscriptions.

definition: a belief that is not true or founded on false premises
sentence: He has delusions about how much money he can make at that job.

definition: captivate or charm
sentence: The storyteller's tales continued to enthrall audiences.

definition: incite or provoke
sentence: He was goaded (on) by a sense of duty.

definition: habitually traveling from place to place
sentence: Itinerant musicians traveled from town to town.

definition: deserving of merit or commendation
sentence: She was given an award for meritorious service.

definition: a rebellion against authority; violent strife
sentence: The mutiny was led by the ship's cook.

definition: pliant, flexible, or easy to bend
sentence: The dancer's supple movements captivated the audience.

definition: strength of mind in the face of danger; bravery
sentence: The soldiers received the nation's highest award for valor.

definition: attracting attention or striking
sentence: The arresting image on the cover drew many readers.

definition: intensely happy or excited
sentence: The team was euphoric after winning the championship.

definition: a foolish and embarrassing error, especially public
sentence: He realized that he had committed/made an awful/embarrassing gaffe when he mispronounced her name.

definition: not violated; free from hurt of any kind
sentence: These rights must remain inviolate.

definition: done with careful attention to detail
sentence: The book describes the election process in painstaking detail.

definition: a feeling of apprehension or doubt
sentence: He accepted their offer without a qualm.

definition: supply an insufficient amount of something
sentence: He had a brief stint as a mail carrier.

definition: making indirect references or hints
sentence: The poem's allusive references required extensive knowledge to understand.

definition: recovering from illness or treatment
sentence: The convalescent patient gradually regained her strength.

definition: publicly criticize or condemn
sentence: Critics continued to decry the proposed changes.

definition: compulsion by threat or force
sentence: He gave the information {phrase}under duress{/phrase}.

definition: be constantly or visibly worried or anxious
sentence: I was sure we wouldn't get there in time, but she told me not to fret.

definition: determined to have one's own way; stubborn
sentence: The headstrong child refused to listen to advice.

definition: occurring at irregular intervals; not continuous
sentence: The patient was having intermittent pains in his side.

definition: anger or wrath
sentence: He directed his ire at the coworkers who reported the incident.

definition: casual and relaxed; weak from disease or weariness
sentence: The languid summer afternoon invited a long nap.

definition: a brief pause or delay in activity
sentence: The music lulled him to sleep.

definition: spirited and brave
sentence: The mettlesome horse proved difficult to train.

definition: lighthearted and lively; having a cheerful attitude
sentence: Despite setbacks, she maintained a buoyant optimism.

definition: of a ruler with absolute power; tyrannical
sentence: The despotic ruler tolerated no opposition.

definition: go off course from; stray from some norm
sentence: The pilot had to deviate from the original flight path due to severe weather.

definition: drive out an evil spirit from a person, place, or thing
sentence: The therapy helped her exorcize the demons of her past.

definition: fussy or hard to please
sentence: The finicky eater refused anything but plain pasta.

definition: prevent something from being accomplished
sentence: Police managed to foil the burglars.

definition: twisted or linked closely together
sentence: The fates of the two families were deeply intertwined.

definition: unbreakable or extremely strong
sentence: The company has an ironclad policy/rule against revealing secrets to competitors.

definition: not aware of or not noticing something
sentence: She seemed oblivious to the chaos around her.

definition: become lower; decrease; become less intense
sentence: The pain/swelling will subside in a couple of hours.

definition: well skilled; completely versed
sentence: He's adept in several languages.

definition: lacking or mourning something or someone
sentence: The family was bereft after the sudden loss.

definition: without doubt
sentence: The investigation failed to produce conclusive evidence.

definition: secretly work together for something bad
sentence: The conspirators met secretly to conspire against the government.

definition: free from entanglement or confusion; make clear
sentence: It took hours to disentangle the complex financial records.

definition: quality or state of being weak; weakness
sentence: Human frailty is a recurring theme in literature.

definition: an issue or problem
sentence: He has a deep sense of grievance against his former employer.

definition: a strategy or tactic used to gain an advantage
sentence: Her story about being sick is only a ploy to get you to give her money.

definition: a state of balance, equilibrium or stability
sentence: She kept her poise even when under attack.

definition: the quality of being pompous; self-importance
sentence: His pomposity made him difficult to work with.

definition: not dense and meager; having widely spaced intervals
sentence: Vegetation was sparse in the desert landscape.

definition: fixed or unchanging; steady
sentence: She remained steadfast in her support despite criticism.

definition: full of passion and enthusiasm
sentence: The ardent fans waited for hours to see their favorite band.

definition: associated with the physical body, not the spirit
sentence: The artist explored the relationship between corporeal and spiritual existence.

definition: rigidly sticking to theoretical ideas rather than practical
sentence: His doctrinaire approach ignored practical realities.

definition: going far beyond what is fair, reasonable, or expected
sentence: The exorbitant prices kept many customers away.

definition: symbolic rather than literal
sentence: The expression should be understood in a figurative sense.

definition: agitated or confused
sentence: She seemed flustered when he asked about her past.

definition: peculiar to an individual or group; unique
sentence: Each artist had an idiosyncratic approach to the medium.

definition: secondary or non-essential part of something
sentence: You may incur some incidental expenses on the trip.

definition: deeply rooted or established
sentence: Such habits become ingrained over many years.

definition: having a quality of horror or grimness
sentence: The artist was known for his macabre sense of humor.

definition: a consequence or resulting action of a previous event
sentence: The decision had ramifications that lasted for decades.

definition: a written work that provides systematic examination of a subject
sentence: The scholar wrote an influential treatise on ethics.

definition: act in opposition to or provoke hostility from
sentence: He didn't mean to antagonize you.

definition: being wary or cautiously reluctant
sentence: Investors were chary of risky ventures after the crash.

definition: intoxicating or stupefying
sentence: The heady days of success eventually gave way to reality.

definition: scold, reprimand, or criticize harshly
sentence: The coach lambasted the team for its poor play.

definition: one who has behaved badly, or illegally
sentence: He supports tough penalties against corporate miscreants.

definition: a small flaw or sin
sentence: The minor peccadillo was quickly forgotten.

definition: obtain money by fraudulent or deceitful methods
sentence: The scheme was designed to swindle investors out of millions.

definition: capable of being touched; real or actual
sentence: The project produced tangible results within months.

definition: undermine; weaken
sentence: They undercut the competing store by 10 percent.

definition: attempt to persuade by flattery
sentence: He wheedled quite a bit of money from her.

definition: showing a fear or hatred of strangers or foreigners
sentence: Xenophobic attitudes can lead to discrimination against immigrants.

definition: an open or intentional offense, slight, or insult
sentence: He regarded her rude behavior as a personal affront.

definition: make someone disturbed or excited
sentence: If I talk about the problem with him it just agitates him even more.

definition: improve or enhance
sentence: The campaign was designed to burnish the company's image.

definition: being bashful, shy, or retiring
sentence: She gave a coy smile when asked about her plans.

definition: the quality of being an enemy; hostility
sentence: There's a long history of enmity between them.

definition: wildly emotional or exaggerated in reaction
sentence: The hysterical reaction was completely out of proportion.

definition: high-pitched and piercing in sound quality
sentence: The shrill whistle signaled the start of the game.

definition: sly, cunning, full of tricks
sentence: She turned out to be a wily negotiator.

definition: humorously dealing with sexual subjects; risque
sentence: The comedian's bawdy jokes made some audience members uncomfortable.

definition: secretly cooperate for deceitful or fraudulent purposes
sentence: The two companies had colluded to fix prices.

definition: a small disagreement or mishap
sentence: The senator dismissed his disagreement with the President as a minor contretemps.

definition: sing softly, typically in a sentimental manner
sentence: The singer began to croon a romantic ballad.

definition: forcibly remove someone from office or power
sentence: The military moved to depose the corrupt leader.

definition: a period of improved relations between countries
sentence: The era of detente eased tensions between the superpowers.

definition: lacking style or elegance; out of fashion
sentence: She played a dowdy old woman in the film.

definition: a level or tier within a system or organization
sentence: Only the upper echelons of management knew the full plan.

definition: filled with tension, stress, or negative emotions
sentence: The negotiations were fraught with difficulties.

definition: merry and in high spirits; exhibiting happiness
sentence: His jocund spirit lifted everyone's mood.

definition: become weak or feeble, often from neglect
sentence: The bill continued to languish in committee.

definition: quick and agile in movement or thinking
sentence: The nimble gymnast performed a flawless routine.

definition: strange, unusual, or bizarre in appearance or style
sentence: The outlandish costume drew stares from passersby.

definition: displaying or prompting undue interest in sexual matters
sentence: The tabloid catered to prurient interests.

definition: taking pleasure in causing pain or suffering
sentence: The sadistic treatment of prisoners shocked the world.

definition: young and inexperienced; immature
sentence: The callow youth had much to learn about the world.

definition: behavior or manners
sentence: The school emphasized proper deportment.

definition: improvise, especially in speech or performance
sentence: The musician was able to extemporize brilliantly.

definition: causing division or disagreement
sentence: Factious infighting weakened the party.

definition: not cultivated; barren; inactive
sentence: The farmer let the field lie fallow for a season.

definition: a deceptive movement or action
sentence: The boxer's feint fooled his opponent.

definition: show submission or fear; beg for favor
sentence: He refused to grovel before his critics.

definition: not in good taste; inappropriate or unseemly
sentence: Such indecorous behavior was frowned upon at court.

definition: showing courage or determination
sentence: The plucky underdog won the hearts of fans.

definition: untidy, especially in personal appearance
sentence: His slovenly appearance made a poor impression.

definition: reject or refuse disdainfully
sentence: She spurned all offers of assistance.

definition: energy, enthusiasm, or vigor
sentence: She approached the project with characteristic verve.

definition: shocked or horrified; struck with amazement
sentence: She was aghast at the state of the neglected garden.

definition: inform, notify, or advise
sentence: Please apprise me of any developments.

definition: a good thing; a blessing or a benefit
sentence: The new highway was a boon for local businesses.

definition: emotionally unfeeling or insensitive
sentence: His callous indifference to suffering appalled us.

definition: pamper or treat with excessive care
sentence: The teacher refused to coddle students who didn't try.

definition: the loudest or highest point of something
sentence: The music built to a powerful crescendo.

definition: lessening the seriousness by providing excuses
sentence: The judge considered the extenuating circumstances before passing sentence.

definition: unconventional, extreme, or marginal
sentence: Fringe theories gained mainstream attention.

definition: spotlessly clean or free from errors
sentence: The hotel room was immaculate, without a speck of dust anywhere.

definition: heavy or slow-moving, often due to weight; extremely dull
sentence: The ponderous bureaucracy moved slowly.

definition: an ecstatic expression of feeling or enthusiasm
sentence: The critic's rhapsody about the film seemed excessive.

definition: avoid or neglect a responsibility or duty
sentence: She never shirked her responsibilities.

definition: involving ignoble actions and motives
sentence: The investigation revealed sordid details about corruption.

definition: stop or reduce the flow of
sentence: Medics worked frantically to stanch the bleeding.

definition: supplementary or additional, often in support
sentence: The hospital called in auxiliary staff during the crisis.

definition: exaggerate features for comedic or satirical effect
sentence: The artist drew caricatures of tourists.

definition: the state or condition of being morally corrupted
sentence: The extent of their depravity shocked investigators.

definition: intrude or trespass, especially on another's territory
sentence: Development continued to encroach on the wetlands.

definition: enrich or furnish with some faculty or quality
sentence: Nature had endowed her with exceptional talent.

definition: ask earnestly or anxiously; beg
sentence: He entreated the judge for mercy.

definition: an official formal accusation for a criminal offense
sentence: The grand jury returned an indictment on all charges.

definition: curious or eager to acquire knowledge
sentence: The inquisitive child asked endless questions.

definition: showing ill will or wishing harm to others
sentence: The malevolent glare suggested trouble ahead.

definition: bring peace to or calm someone down
sentence: Officials struggled to pacify the angry crowd.

definition: treat with condescending kindness; be a regular customer
sentence: Don't patronize me—I understand the situation perfectly.

definition: stimulating to the senses; engaging; charming
sentence: The sauce had a piquant flavor.
